question_text: A botanist is studying the growth of a sunflower. The table below shows the height, in centimeters (cm), of the sunflower at the beginning of the experiment and at 1-week intervals thereafter.  | Week | Height (cm) | |---|---| | 0 | 2 | | 1 | 5 | | 2 | 9 | | 3 | 12 | | 4 | 14 | | 5 | 15 |  During which of the following 1-week intervals does the height of the sunflower increase at the greatest average rate?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows the number of hours students studied for a test and their corresponding test scores. A line of best fit for the data is also shown. According to the line of best fit, what test score is predicted for a student who studied for 5 hours?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows the relationship between the number of hours students studied for a test and their test scores.  According to the line of best fit for the data, which of the following is closest to the predicted test score for a student who studied for 3.5 hours?
subject: Math

question_text: The graph above shows the relationship between the number of hours a student studies for a test and their score on the test, in points. Approximately how many more points will a student score if they study for 8 hours than if they study for 4 hours?
subject: Math

question_text: Each dot in the scatterplot above represents the number of hours students studied per week and their corresponding exam scores in a class. The line of best fit for the data is also shown. According to the line of best fit, what is the predicted exam score, rounded to the nearest 10, for a student who studies for 15 hours per week?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot shows the number of daily visitors, $y$, to a museum recorded over several months, $x$, since its grand reopening in March.   During which of the following time periods did the greatest increase in the number of daily visitors take place?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot below shows the number of hours spent per week exercising and the resting heart rate of 12 individuals. A line of best fit for the data is also shown. Which of the following statements best describes the association between the number of hours spent exercising per week and the resting heart rate?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows the fuel efficiency, in miles per gallon (mpg), of 7 car models with respect to their engine size, in liters (L). The line of best fit is also shown. A new car model has an engine size of 3.2 liters. According to the line of best fit, which of the following best approximates the fuel efficiency of this car model, in miles per gallon?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot shows the relationship between the number of hours spent exercising per week and the resting heart rate, in beats per minute (bpm), for 12 adults.   Based on the scatterplot, what is the approximate resting heart rate, in bpm, for an adult who exercises 5 hours per week?
subject: Math

question_text: The table shows selected values from function g.  | x | g(x) | |---|------| | 0 | 5    | | 1 | 10   | | 2 | 20   | | 3 | 40   |  Which of the following is the best description of function g?
subject: Math

question_text: A student recorded the number of hours they studied and their corresponding test scores for five different tests. The scatterplot shows this data for study hours and test scores. The data points on the scatterplot are (1, 60), (2, 70), (3, 80), (4, 85), and (5, 90), where the x-coordinate represents the study hours and the y-coordinate represents the test score.  What was the test score the student received when they studied for 3 hours?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot shows the relationship between the number of hours students studied for a test and their test scores. A line of best fit for the data is also shown. Which of the following is closest to the difference between the test score of the student who studied for 5 hours and the test score predicted by the line of best fit for a student who studied for 5 hours?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot below shows the relationship between the number of hours students spent watching television per week and their scores on a recent exam. A line of best fit is shown for the data.  [![](_page_1_Figure_6.jpeg)](_page_1_Figure_6.jpeg)  Which of the following is closest to the slope of this line of best fit?
subject: Math

question_text: Which of the following is true about the values of $3^x$ and $3x+1$ for $x > 0$?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot shows the relationship between altitude above sea level, in feet, and atmospheric pressure, in pounds per square inch (psi). A line of best fit is also shown.  [Imagine a scatterplot visually similar to the original example, but with altitude on the x-axis and atmospheric pressure on the y-axis. The line of best fit is downward sloping, passing approximately through the points (0, 15) and (10000, 10).]  Which of the following is closest to the slope of the line of best fit shown?
subject: Math

question_text: A water tank initially contains 500 gallons of water. Water drains from the tank at a constant rate of 10 gallons per minute. Which type of model is best to represent the amount of water remaining in the tank, in gallons, after $m$ minutes?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows data for eight students relating their hours studied per week to their exam score percentage, along with the line of best fit. For the student who studied the greatest number of hours per week, which of the following is closest to the actual exam score percentage and the percentage predicted by the line of best fit?
subject: Math

question_text: Each dot in the scatterplot above represents the number of practice SAT Math tests taken, $x$, and the increase in SAT Math score, $y$, for each student in a group of twenty students. The graph of which of the following equations is a line that most closely fits the data?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows the relationship between the number of hours a student spent tutoring per week and their final exam score in mathematics. In this scatterplot, $t$ represents the number of tutoring hours per week, and $s$ represents the final exam score. A line of best fit is also shown. Which of the following could be an equation of the line of best fit?
subject: Math

question_text: In which of the following tables is the relationship between the values of x and their corresponding y-values nonlinear?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot below shows the relationship between the number of hours a group of students spent volunteering and their final exam scores.  Which of the following equations could represent a line of best fit for the data shown in the scatterplot?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot shows the relationship between the number of hours students studied for a test and their scores on the test. A line of best fit for the data is also shown.  ![](1__page_16_Figure_5_modified.png)  Based on the line of best fit, what is the predicted test score for a student who studied for 7 hours?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows the relationship between the number of hours a group of students spent studying for a test and their scores on the test. A line of best fit is shown, and its equation is $\textit{y} = 7.2\textit{x} + 65$, where $\textit{x}$ represents the number of study hours and $\textit{y}$ represents the predicted test score. According to the line of best fit, what is the predicted increase in test score for each additional hour of study?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows a company's sales $s$, in thousands of dollars, and advertising spending $a$, in thousands of dollars, on 12 different months. A line of best fit for the data is also shown. Which of the following could be an equation of the line of best fit?  ![](_page_1_Figure_1_NEW.jpeg)  ``` 10 20 30 40 50  Advertising Spending (thousands of dollars) ```
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot shows the relationship between the height of a sunflower, y, in centimeters, and the number of weeks after planting, x.  [![](_page_3_Figure_5_sunflower.jpeg)  *(Placeholder for scatterplot image: x-axis labeled 'Weeks after Planting', y-axis labeled 'Sunflower Height (cm)'. Points approximately at (1, 5), (3, 12), (5, 20), (7, 26), (9, 30).)*]  What is the average rate of change, in centimeters per week, of the sunflower's height from week 3 to week 7?
subject: Math

question_text: Each dot in the scatterplot above represents the number of hours spent exercising per week and the resting heart rate of several adults. The line of best fit for the data is also shown. The line of best fit for the data has a slope of approximately -2.5. According to this estimate, how much lower is a person's predicted resting heart rate for each 4-hour increase in exercise per week?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot below shows the height of a ball, in feet, at different times after it was thrown upwards into the air. Time is measured in seconds since the ball was thrown.   Of the following equations, which best models the data in the scatterplot?
subject: Math

question_text: The scatterplot above shows the number of hours students studied per week and their exam scores (out of 100) for eight students in a class. The line of best fit for the data is also shown. According to the line of best fit, which of the following is closest to the predicted increase in exam score for every increase of 1 hour of study per week?
subject: Math
